response: "{ \"title\": \"Reorganizing an Array of Integers\", \"description\": \"Given a list of integers, reorganize it such that all the even numbers come first, followed by the odd numbers. The order of even and odd numbers within their respective groups does not matter.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef reorganize_array(nums: list[int]) -> list[int]:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `nums` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns a new list where all even numbers come first, followed by the odd numbers.\", \"code\": \"from typing import List, Dict\\n\\ndef reorganize_array(nums: List[int]) -> List[int]:\\n    # Create dictionaries to separate even and odd numbers\\n    evens: Dict[int, int] = {}\\n    odds: Dict[int, int] = {}\\n\\n    for num in nums:\\n        if num % 2 == 0:\\n            evens[num] = None\\n        else:\\n            odds[num] = None\\n\\n    # Combine the dictionaries into a single list\\n    result = []\\n    for num in sorted(evens.keys()):\\n        result.append(num)\\n    for num in sorted(odds.keys()):\\n        result.append(num)\\n\\n    return result\", \"tests\": [\"assert reorganize_array([1, 2, 3, 4]) == [2, 4, 1, 3]\", \"assert reorganize_array([-5, -2, 0, 3, 7]) == [-2, 0, -5, 3, 7]\", \"assert reorganize_array([10, 9, 8, 7, 6]) == [8, 6, 10, 9, 7]\"] }"
